CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 18, reads: "Neighborhood Club Reviews Works - A group of civic-minded matrons, members of the well known Neighborhood Charity Club, look over some of their accomplishments for the past year. The group is best known for its efforts in raising money to buy braces for Walter Wright who died recently, an infantile paralis [paralysis] victim.  The club grew out of this venture.  Officers include Mrs. Esther Green, president; Mrs. Gurtha Perkins, vice president; Mrs. Marie Forbush, treasurer; Mrs. Marie Hison, recording secretary; Mrs. Johnnie Mae Lampkin, chairman, and Mrs. Alberta Bacon. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Neighborhood Charity Club members including Esther Green, Gurtha Perkins, Marie Forbush, Marie Hison, Johnnie Mae Lampkin, and Alberta Bacon, posed in domestic dining room
